subject: Fines (Penalties)
Decisions and Verdicts
Courts and the Judiciary
organizations: Ninth U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals
lead_paragraph: Judges on the Ninth U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals on Thursday questioned the soundness of Barry Bonds’s conviction for obstruction of justice stemming from a rambling response to a grand jury in 2003 and left open the possibility that they could throw out the verdict.
